required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Responds to Dermal Chelation
clinical_study.official_title: Dermal Chelation Lowers White Blood Cell Count in Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical trial is to identify 50 participants with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) and follow their total white blood cell (WBC) counts and absolute lymphocyte counts after performing dermal chelation and administering nutritional therapy

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this clinical trial is to use dermal chelation and hair tissue analysis to identify 50 participants with CLL. The total wbc counts and absolute lymphocyte counts of these participants will be followed after serial dermal chelations and nutritional therapy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Clinical trials with a single arm

primary_outcome.measure: Serial Total White Blood Cell Count
primary_outcome.description: Total WBC counts taken on a regular interval.

arm_group.description: Group receiving dermal chelation and nutritional therapy

intervention.description: Dermal chelation with Aqua DetoxTM system for one or more hours one or more times each week.
Vitamins and minerals that will be taken one or more times a day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia and has a toxic heavy metal load
- Toxic heavy metal load
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Pacemaker implants
- Organ transplant recipients
- Psychotic episodes or epileptic seizures
